info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 4:55PM EDT until June 26 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In northwest North Carolina, Wilkes and Yadkin.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain producing thunderstorms which prompted the advisory have dissipated. However, runoff from these earlier heavy rains is still expected to collect in streams and low-lying areas, helping to maintain the threat for flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Arnold Branch, Dobbins Creek, Cobb Creek, Cranberry Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek, Camp Creek, East Swan Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Deep Creek and Elkin Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkin... Yadkinville... Jonesville... Boonville... Ronda... Brooks Crossroads... Nebo... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
